intro: Siolmatra simplicifolia, commonly known as the simpleleaf sunbloom, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the eastern hemisphere. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Siolmatra simplicifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators.
